description:
March 14 every year is colloquially known as "Pi Day" in the United States, as the date as-written in the country shows 3.14.xxxx. As a result, UNESCO designated March 14 as "International Mathematics Day" in 2019.

Wordle is a popular game owned by the New York Times you can find here: https://www.nytimes.com/games/wordle/index.html

This market asks whether the answer to the Wordle of the day's answer on March 14, 2022 will include either the letter "P" or the letter "I", or both the letters "P" and "I". If the Wordle of the day's answer on March 14, 2022 contains either the letter "P" or the letter "I", or both the letters "P" and "I", this market will resolve to "Yes". Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

Note: New Wordles go live every day at 12:00:00 AM ET. This market is for the Wordle that goes live on March 14, 12:00:00 AM ET, and ends on March 15, 12:00:00 AM ET.

The resolution source for this market will be the official Wordle game (located at https://www.nytimes.com/games/wordle/index.html as of this market's writing, however if the URL for the game changes the resolution url will also change). If the official Wordle website is unavailable for all of March 14, 2022, this market will resolve to 50-50.

markets.question: Will the Wordle word on Pi day contain a "P" or an "I"?

title: Will the Wordle word on Pi day contain a "P" or an "I"?
